content.description:
Sit start with a left hand jug on the rail and a right on a sidepull pocket.  From there, cross over a big left hand to a crimp (crux), match hands, then head straight compressing the crimps, and top it out.

The first move is the most difficult, it's not too bad with the proper foot beta though.
content.protection: A few pads, but great landing though.
content.location:
It is on the North face of Boonies Boulder. Do the same start as

Lacing Skittles

.

content.description:
Sit start with a left jug on the rail and a right hand on a sidepull pocket.  From there, cross over a  big left hand to a crimp (crux), match hands on the rail, traverse to the right, and top it out.

The first move is the most difficult, it is not too bad with the right feet though.
content.protection: A few pads, but good landing though.
content.location:
This is on the North face of Boonies Boulder.  Do the same start as

Sea Legs

.

content.description:
Sit start with both hands matched in the large hueco.  From there, move up through the good rail to the lip and top it out.

The hueco required a good stretch for me to do a proper start.  Shorter folks may need an extra pad.
content.protection: A pad, but the landing is great though.
content.location: This ascends the center of the north face of Boonies Boulder.
